original_solution_mapping.L1: Pedro has 100 squares - 60 squares = <<100-60=40>>40 more squares than Jesus.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Pedro has 100 squares - 75 squares = <<100-75=25>>25 more squares than Linden.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6225.
    Returns: how many more squares Pedro has than both Jesus and Linden combined.
    """
    # L1
    pedro_squares_in_solution = 100 # This value is used in the solution, but the question states Pedro has 200 squares. Following direct substitution rule.
    jesus_squares = 60 # Jesus has 60 squares
    pedro_more_than_jesus = pedro_squares_in_solution - jesus_squares

    # L2
    linden_squares = 75 # Linden has 75 squares
    pedro_more_than_linden = pedro_squares_in_solution - linden_squares

    # L3
    total_more_squares = pedro_more_than_jesus + pedro_more_than_linden

    # FA
    answer = total_more_squares
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Pedro has {pedro_squares_in_solution} squares - {jesus_squares} squares = <<{pedro_squares_in_solution}-{jesus_squares}={pedro_more_than_jesus}>>{pedro_more_than_jesus} more squares than Jesus.
Pedro has {pedro_squares_in_solution} squares - {linden_squares} squares = <<{pedro_squares_in_solution}-{linden_squares}={pedro_more_than_linden}>>{pedro_more_than_linden} more squares than Linden.

Combined Pedro has {pedro_more_than_jesus} squares + {pedro_more_than_linden} squares = <<{pedro_more_than_jesus}+{pedro_more_than_linden}={total_more_squares}>>{total_more_squares} squares more than both Jesus and Linden.
